data.title: 1845 Night and Morning Edward Bulwer Lytton Frontispiece Engraved Title Novel

data.text:
Description

Original Binding

With an engraved title page and frontispiece. Published as part of a wider complete works. Edward Bulwer-Lytton was an English novelist, poet, playwright and politician. His novels were very popular and coined many well known phrases in the English language. Night and Morning is a part inheritance novel and part mystery narrative featuring a character named Monsieur Favart, a Parisian police chief.

Condition

In a cloth binding. Externally, smart with bumping and rubbing. Wear to head and tail of spine. Front hinge strained.Internally, firmly bound. Pages bright and clean aside from spotting to frontispiece and engraved title.

Overall: Very Good

Delivery & payment

We send all of our books via courier which is a fully tracked and insured service. In our experience we find this to be the most reliable and quickest form of delivery. Our primary courier is DHL, but we are able to accommodate special requests if required, including postal delivery for items under 2kg. See More Details
